headline: Tesla price target raised to $551 from $482 at Canaccord
summary: Canaccord raised the firm’s price target on Tesla (TSLA) to $551 from $482 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The firm reduced its Q4 delivery outlook for Tesla to 427,000 from 470,000, citing a sharper than anticipated deterioration in demand, with weakness broad-based across products and regions. However, even with the Q4 estimate cut, Canaccord sees “constructive developments beneath the surface” for Tesla. The recent share rally shows the market is looking through Q4, the analyst tells in

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Nike, UiPath, Tesla, AMC, Strategy, and More
summary: Stock futures were a touch lower on Wednesday, as investors waited to see if a Santa Claus rally would lift markets over the final few trading sessions of 2025.  Nike  climbed 2.2% to $58.57 in premarket trading.  Cook snapped up the stock following Nike’s second-quarter earnings report last week, which disappointed investors due to declining profits and lackluster sales in China.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Intel, Nike, UiPath, Tesla, AMC, Strategy, Dynavax, and More
summary: Stock futures were a touch lower on Wednesday, as investors waited to see if a Santa Claus rally would lift markets over the final few trading sessions of 2025.  Intel   fell 2.5% in premarket trading after Reuters reported that  Nvidia  had tested whether to manufacture chips using Intel’s production process but stopped moving forward with the plans.  Nvidia  and Intel didn’t immediately respond to Barron’s requests for comment.

headline: Tesla Stock Drops as U.S. Auto Regulator Probes Alleged Model 3 Door Defects
summary: The U.S. auto safety regulator has opened an investigation into the mechanical door release on the 2022  Tesla  Model 3.  The probe, launched Tuesday by the Office of Defects Investigation at the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, or NHTSA, covers an estimated 179,071 vehicles.  Tesla didn’t immediately respond to Barron’s request for comment.

content.title: Tesla Stock Drops as U.S. Auto Regulator Probes Alleged Model 3 Door Defects
content.summary: The U.S. auto safety regulator has opened an investigation into the mechanical door release on the 2022  Tesla  Model 3.  The probe, launched Tuesday by the Office of Defects Investigation at the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, or NHTSA, covers an estimated 179,071 vehicles.  Tesla didn’t immediately respond to Barron’s request for comment.

headline: As Markets Rise, Risk-Taking Takes a Back Seat
summary: Yes, the Dow has gained nearly 300 points, or 0.6%, and the S&P 500 has risen 0.3%, but the tech-heavy Nasdaq, which has advanced 0.2%, is barely higher, and the small-cap Russell 2000 is up just 0.1%.  The Invesco S&P 500 High Beta exchange-traded fund, which owns the index’s most volatile stocks such as AppLovin, Tesla, and Microchip, is up just 0.2% on Wednesday.  The Invesco S&P 500 Pure Growth ETF, with its portfolio of fast-growing, but more speculative companies like Palantir, is also up just 0.2%.

content.title: As Markets Rise, Risk-Taking Takes a Back Seat
content.summary: Yes, the Dow has gained nearly 300 points, or 0.6%, and the S&P 500 has risen 0.3%, but the tech-heavy Nasdaq, which has advanced 0.2%, is barely higher, and the small-cap Russell 2000 is up just 0.1%.  The Invesco S&P 500 High Beta exchange-traded fund, which owns the index’s most volatile stocks such as AppLovin, Tesla, and Microchip, is up just 0.2% on Wednesday.  The Invesco S&P 500 Pure Growth ETF, with its portfolio of fast-growing, but more speculative companies like Palantir, is also up just 0.2%.

headline: Tesla Under Investigation by U.S. Regulator for Model 3 Door Release Defects
summary: The Office of Defects Investigation at the NHTSA opened the investigation Wednesday after receiving a petition in late November. The office said the issue is estimated to affect more than 179,000 cars.

content.title: Tesla Under Investigation by U.S. Regulator for Model 3 Door Release Defects

headline: Tesla Faces NHTSA Probe Over Model 3 Emergency Door Handles
summary: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said it’s evaluating claims that the mechanical door release “is hidden, unlabeled, and not intuitive to locate during an emergency,” according to a filing on the agency’s website.  The move stems from a petition filed by Kevin Clouse, a Tesla owner in Georgia who says he was trapped in his vehicle in 2023 and requested a defect investigation.  NHTSA said it hasn’t decided whether to grant or deny the petition.

content.title: Tesla Faces NHTSA Probe Over Model 3 Emergency Door Handles
content.summary: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said it’s evaluating claims that the mechanical door release “is hidden, unlabeled, and not intuitive to locate during an emergency,” according to a filing on the agency’s website.  The move stems from a petition filed by Kevin Clouse, a Tesla owner in Georgia who says he was trapped in his vehicle in 2023 and requested a defect investigation.  NHTSA said it hasn’t decided whether to grant or deny the petition.
